intro: Spilanthes muticus, commonly known as the Indian mustard or bitter cress, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, four-petaled flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and thrives in open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers range in color from white to pale yellow. Spilanthes muticus is known for its pungent odor and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
